page.title: 14Welsh Frankton.
page.content: Welsh Frankton is a small settlement occupying a position at the top of the Brow.This forms the southernmost edge of the hills that stretch away to the North-West and Wales. The village is dominated by St. Andrews church, built in 1858 by public subscription. It is unusual in the size and position of the steeple which starts from a massive base and tapers away rapidly. It is also positioned on the side rather than the end of the church. The walls are heavily butressed and the vestry was enlarged in 1898. The remainder of the village comprises a few cottages, a shop and a service station. The village hall provides youth facilities and Frankton maintains a flourishing cricket club.
